alert.note: Alert for Athens; Morgan; Perry; Washington (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 2:03PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Perry, northwestern Washington, Morgan and northern Athens Counties through 230 PM EDT... At 201 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorms near Glouster, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Glouster, McConnelsville, Beverly, Chesterhill, Nelsonville, Chauncey, New Straitsville, Malta, Corning, Buchtel, Lowell, Stockport, Jacksonville, Murray City, Trimble, Bristol, Hemlock, Rendville, Burr Oak State Park and Hackney. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
